title: Mathematical Modeling-Based Mobile Microlearning Course for Gen Z Nursing Education: Probability and Statistical Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of basic nursing knowledge and job experience, understanding of fundamental statistical concepts (mean, variance, standard deviation) and probability (conditional probability, Bayes' theorem), and foundational comprehension of linear regression models
context.additional_context: A Customized Education Course for Office Workers Aged 40+ Reflecting the Characteristics of Gen Z Nursing Learners and the Educational Needs of Digital Natives. Collecting pre- and post-education achievement data for independent samples t-tests and Pearson correlation analysis to measure learning effectiveness. Analyzing educational satisfaction data via chi-square tests

learning_goals: The learning curve of educational content reflecting Gen Z learners' preference for digital environments can be analyzed using an exponential function model.
A Markov chain probability model is applied to mobile-based microlearning strategies to develop an effective nursing education process.
Customized teaching methods considering generational trait differences are validated via regression analysis and ANOVA to improve educational satisfaction by 15%.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
